div.a: Android Is Popular Because It's Cheap, Not Because It's Good

div.div: The story goes like this: The iPhone comes out, and it's the only smartphone anyone wants, because there's never been anything like it. It is the smartphone. Step forward a few years, and Apple is losing to Google—at least in sheer numbers of phones being sold. What happened? People without money happened.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V4sBQ7&via=Digg&text=Android Is Popular Because It's Cheap, Not Because It's Good

div.div: BO IS MORE OBEDIENT THAN BIDEN

div.a: The Best Moment From Barack And Michelle Obama Surprising A White House Tour

div.div: Barack and Michelle Obama surprised a White House group tour today. Some things happened.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VRlFIS&via=Digg&text=The Best Moment From Barack And Michelle Obama Surprising A White House Tour

div.a: Watch A Penguin Catch 14 Fish In 20 Seconds

div.div: Although the data gathered by these camera-equipped penguins has been incredibly useful to scientists, the footage is also just plain enjoyable to watch.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WI7yDZ&via=Digg&text=Watch A Penguin Catch 14 Fish In 20 Seconds

div.a: Why The U.S. Can't Just Drone Algeria

div.div: During the four-day siege of the In Amenas gas field, which culminated in an opaque takeover by the Algerian military that reportedly killed dozens, several pundits and journalists asked why the U.S. military did not send drones or special operations forces to free the hostages or kill the Islamist militants holding them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XxZCo7&via=Digg&text=Why The U.S. Can't Just Drone Algeria

div.a: This Robot Can Serve Up 360 Hamburgers Per Hour

div.div: No longer will they say, “He’s going to end up flipping burgers.” Because now, robots are taking even these ignobly esteemed jobs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XUARo8&via=Digg&text=This Robot Can Serve Up 360 Hamburgers Per Hour

div.a: How A New Manhattan Neighborhood Will Be Constructed Over Active Train Tracks

div.div: Imagine you had to build four towers, one of them nearly the tallest in Manhattan, on top of nearly a dozen active train tracks—without disrupting the daily train traffic. How would you go about it?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13Yy5l4&via=Digg&text=How A New Manhattan Neighborhood Will Be Constructed Over Active Train Tracks

div.div: An unscientific new survey says it does. But experts argue that it can actually help.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13YnxTU&via=Digg&text=Does Porn Hurt Relationships?

div.a: Watch A Biplane Nearly Decapitate Two People

div.div: Standing on an active runway is not the best idea in the world. Standing on an active runway when a stunt plane is buzzing about three feet off the ground is even dumber.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10oJoPR&via=Digg&text=Watch A Biplane Nearly Decapitate Two People

div.a: Texting While Driving Hands-Free Is Still Very Unsafe, Says Science

div.div: California just passed a law that says drivers are free to text and email while they drive, as long as they're doing it by voice. Sounds safer, right? Not exactly, according to quite a bit of research.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VkvptT&via=Digg&text=Texting While Driving Hands-Free Is Still Very Unsafe, Says Science

div.div: HE TOLD YOU HE'D BE BACK

div.a: Arnold Schwarzenegger To Appear In Terminator 5

div.div: The bodybuilder turned action star turned governor turned washed-up action star announced during a London press junket that he will indeed be appearing in the next "Terminator" movie.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10mDVZL&via=Digg&text=Arnold Schwarzenegger To Appear In Terminator 5

div.a: Signs Of CTE Found In Living Ex-NFL Players For The First Time

div.div: Brain scans performed on five former NFL players revealed images of the protein that causes football-related brain damage -- the first time researchers have identified signs of the crippling disease in living players.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10puzwy&via=Digg&text=Signs Of CTE Found In Living Ex-NFL Players For The First Time

div.a: What Really Happened On K2's Deadliest Day?

div.div: August 1, 2008 began as a beautiful day for a summit attempt on the 8,611-meter K2. But by day's end, 11 climbers were dead — and the ones who survived had widely divergent accounts of the events that transpired.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11NbMjO&via=Digg&text=What Really Happened On K2's Deadliest Day?

div.style: color: #IT'S NEVER TO EARLY TO THINK ABOUT 2016;

div.div: IT'S NEVER TO EARLY TO THINK ABOUT 2016

div.a: Joe Biden Is Running For President

div.div: One thing became abundantly clear during the past several days of inauguration festivities in Washington, D.C.: Joe Biden is running for president in 2016.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UicUaA&via=Digg&text=Joe Biden Is Running For President

div.a: Hooters Gets A Classy New Look

div.div: When you think Hooters, you don’t exactly think “classy.” You think, “Damn, I get wait to grab a beer and grab some wings.” Right.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VoUOmp&via=Digg&text=Hooters Gets A Classy New Look

div.a: A Battle For The Best 'Chappelle's Show' Sketch Ever

div.div: Sixty-four sketches. One winner. Ten years later, a champion will be crowned.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UQei3t&via=Digg&text=A Battle For The Best 'Chappelle's Show' Sketch Ever

div.a: New York City Unveils Its Vision For Micro-Apartments

div.div: New York City today announced the winner of its competition to design micro-apartments, between 250 and 370 square feet, intended to address a shortage of housing stock for single New Yorkers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WTwfMj&via=Digg&text=New York City Unveils Its Vision For Micro-Apartments

div.a: The First Pizza Ever Ordered By A Computer

div.div: By the late 1960s, technologists were already inventing the future we now inhabit. While others got to work developing things like the internet, The Artificial Language Laboratory at Michigan State developed a way for the computer to start doing some everyday commerce — like ordering pizza.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TdYc6F&via=Digg&text=The First Pizza Ever Ordered By A Computer

div.a: What Happens If You Become Seriously Ill During A Flight?

div.div: You may be surprised to find out that the primary role of flight attendants isn't getting you a second tiny bag of free peanuts. It's ensuring the safety of passengers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10EuDgu&via=Digg&text=What Happens If You Become Seriously Ill During A Flight?

div.div: GOOD THING THERE'S PLENTY OF HYPERBOLE
Google is becoming less useful, and Facebook search isn't ready yet. Welcome to the search desert.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SxLs9p&via=Digg&text=Welcome To Search Hell

div.div: B/C YOU DESERVE TO LAUGH AT OTHER'S MISERY

div.a: Two And A Half Minutes Of Segway Fails

div.div: This is a video compilation of people sucking at riding Segways. This little girl here ran into a wall and then proceeded to run herself over. I imagine she cried after that. Not because it hurt, but because that's like, REALLY embarrassing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XUQHiB&via=Digg&text=Two And A Half Minutes Of Segway Fails

div.a: The History Of The Prepper Paradise Known As The Citadel

div.div: This is the story, mostly told through blog posts, of a dreamed-up prepper community called The Citadel where denizens can train in militias by day, dine on BBQ by night all while holing up in an Obama-pocalypse proof fort.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vng63U&via=Digg&text=The History Of The Prepper Paradise Known As The Citadel

div.a: Why We Go Crazy For Cute

div.div: Ever reacted to the sight of a cute puppy or darling infant by squealing, "I want to eat you up!"? You're not alone. New research finds that seemingly strange aggressive responses to cuteness are actually the norm.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V2776e&via=Digg&text=Why We Go Crazy For Cute

div.a: This Maze Took 7 Years To Make, And It Might Be Impossible To Clear

div.div: Seven years and several months a Japanese man drew this maze on a sheet of A1 paper that measures approximately 35 by 23.3 inches.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XTxJc8&via=Digg&text=This Maze Took 7 Years To Make, And It Might Be Impossible To Clear

div.div: IF THIS IS YOUR PHONE NUMBER, WE'RE SORRY

div.a: Fascinating Business Cards Of The World’s Most Famous People

div.div: Business cards can be surprisingly insightful—especially if they bear the names of history’s most famous personalities.

div.div: If Zagat did a guide to brothels, they might want to consider a consultation with photographer Marc McAndrews.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SwgKgD&via=Digg&text=Inside The American Brothel

div.a: Next-Gen Xbox System Specs Allegedly Leak

div.div: According to reports, this is what will be powering the next generation Xbox.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Stc2QT&via=Digg&text=Next-Gen Xbox System Specs Allegedly Leak

div.a: How Keys Work Explained In One Perfect Animated GIF

div.div: Ever wondered how a key opens a lock? Wonder no more. If this is not one of the best animated GIFs I've ever seen, I don't know what is.
